title: An Empirical Analysis of Participatory Budgeting in Amsterdam. (arXiv:2310.18033v1 [cs.GT])
abstract: Using data from 35 Participatory Budgeting instances in Amsterdam, we empirically compare two different Participatory Budgeting rules: the greedy cost welfare rule and the Method of Equal Shares. We quantify how proportional, equal and fair the rules are and conclude that, for a small price in total voter satisfaction, the Method of Equal Shares performs better on all notions of fairness studied. We further provide a popular and a visual explanation of the Method of Equal Shares.

translated_title: 阿姆斯特丹参与性预算的实证分析
translated_abstract: 通过使用阿姆斯特丹35个参与性预算实例的数据，我们实证比较了两种不同的参与性预算规则：贪婪成本福利规则和平等份额方法。我们量化了这些规则在比例、平等和公平性概念上的表现，并得出结论，尽管在总体选民满意度上付出较小代价，平等份额方法在所有研究的公平概念上表现更好。此外，我们进一步提供了平等份额方法的流行和可视化解释。
tldr: 阿姆斯特丹参与性预算的实证分析研究了贪婪成本福利规则和平等份额方法的比较，并发现平等份额方法在所有公平概念上表现更好。这项研究为平等份额方法提供了流行和可视化的解释。

The study also provides a popular and visual explanation of the Method of Equal Shares.
